titleStmt.title: James D. Webb et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9606

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excelencey Buriah Macgoffin
Govr of the commonwealth of Kentucky

this Petition Respectfully Sheweth that Mr G. W Collins a citizen of the town of Danville was fined By the Police Judg of Said town the Sum of five $5,88 Dollars & 88cts for a Breach of the Peace -- and as we are conversant with the care & Know there was no disturbance of the peace & that mr Collins was induced to confess a Judgment without fully knoing his rights & that the fine perhaps would not have been aflicted had the matter been investigated -- -- therefore we pray that Said fine of five Dollars ^88 cts^be remited & that the Said Collins be released for Ever from the payment of the Same

Jas. D. Webb. D. D.
B. Fishback
M. Newbey
P. R. Bissell
Thos Cook
John, R, Figg
M G Russel
H, C, Swift
Rev S. P. Bowlen
T. T. Taylor
Geo W C Spears Jr
H B Starrwood P. B.
Hon J H Burton
Steven T. Neil
H, Terey
J. G. Russell
Samuel, S, Moore
S. B. Davis
John F. Virden
Jas P, Baldrick
Jackson Davis

Danville Po. Ct
$5 88/100 } breach
G W. Collins
Issd Nov 13. 1860
